echolocatoR: QTL pipeline vignette

Brian M. Schilder

Most recent update:
2020-07-09

Source: vignettes/QTL_pipeline_vignette.Rmd
QTL_pipeline_vignette.Rmd
library(echolocatoR)
#> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally':
#>   method from   
#>   +.gg   ggplot2

QTL pipeline

Prepare top_SNPs data.frame

  • In this case, we donâ€™t have a top SNPs file ready. So weâ€™re just going to make one directly from the full summary stats file itself (NOTE: You can only use this approach if you can fit the entire file in memory).
  • In this case, youâ€™ll want to make sure to set grouping_vars=c("Locus","Gene") so that you get top SNPs for each eGene-locus pair (not just one SNP per locus).
fullSS_path <- "~/Desktop/merged_coloc_results.snp.tsv.gz"

top_SNPs <- import_topSNPs(
  topSS = fullSS_path,
  chrom_col = "chr",
  position_col = "pos",
  snp_col="snp",
  pval_col="gwas.pvalues",
  effect_col="gwas.beta",
  gene_col="gene",
  locus_col = "Locus",
  grouping_vars = c("Locus","Gene"))
head(top_SNPs)
#>          Gene Locus CHR     POS        SNP         P  Effect
#> 1:      ABCA7 ABCA7  19 1050874 rs12151021 2.562e-10  0.1071
#> 2:    ABHD17A ABCA7  19 1050874 rs12151021 2.562e-10  0.1071
#> 3: AC004623.1 ABCA7  19 1050874 rs12151021 2.562e-10  0.1071
#> 4: AC006277.1 ABCA7  19 1959773 rs56076117 2.345e-02 -0.0423
#> 5: AC006538.3 ABCA7  19 1923909 rs12610391 2.449e-03 -0.0693
#> 6: AC008993.1 ABCA7  19 1050874 rs12151021 2.562e-10  0.1071

eGene-locus list

  • In finemap_loci() we usually supply loci= with a list of locus names. However,when fine-mapping GWAS-QTL jointly, youâ€™ll need to specify which QTL eGene-GWAS locus pairs you want to run.
  • You can easy get this named list of all eGene-locus pairs with gene_locus_list(). The returned listâ€™s values are the GWAS loci, while the names are the QTL eGenes.
  • If you donâ€™t want to test all pairs, you can filter the top_SNPs object first. In this example, Iâ€™m going to remove any pairs that donâ€™t have matching eGene-locus names.
    Weâ€™ll also limit the anaylsis to just 3 loci.
loci <- gene_locus_list(top_SNPs=subset(top_SNPs, Gene==Locus))
# We'll just fine-map 2 loci to start
loci <- loci[1:3]
loci
#>    ABCA7      ACE   ADAM10 
#>  "ABCA7"    "ACE" "ADAM10"

Run fine-mapping pipeline

NOTE: Currently this finemap_loci() will only fine-map the GWAS results. However you can still plot the fine-mapped GWAS results using the QTL_prefixes argument.

Kunkle_2019.microgliaQTL <- finemap_loci(# GENERAL ARGUMENTS 
                                        top_SNPs = top_SNPs,
                                        results_dir = "~/Desktop/results",

                                        loci = loci,
                                        dataset_name = "Kunkle_2019.microgliaQTL",
                                        dataset_type = "GWAS",
                                        sample_size = 21982 + 41944,
                                        proportion_cases = 21982 / 41944,
                                        force_new_subset = F,
                                        force_new_LD = F,
                                        force_new_finemap = F,
                                        remove_tmps = T,

                 # SUMMARY STATS ARGUMENTS
                 fullSS_path = fullSS_path,
                 query_by ="coordinates",
                 chrom_col = "chr",
                 position_col = "pos",
                 snp_col = "snp",
                 pval_col = "gwas.pvalues",
                 effect_col = "gwas.beta",
                 stderr_col = "gwas.varbeta",
                 MAF_col = "gwas.MAF",
                 gene_col = "gene",

                 # QTL prefixes
                 QTL_prefixes = c("qtl."),

                 # FILTERING ARGUMENTS
                 bp_distance = 500000, #100000,
                 min_MAF = 0.001,

                 # FINE-MAPPING ARGUMENTS
                 finemap_methods = c("ABF","FINEMAP","SUSIE","POLYFUN_SUSIE"),
                 n_causal = 5,
                 PP_threshold = .95,

                 # LD ARGUMENTS 
                 LD_reference = "1KGphase1",
                 superpopulation = "EUR",
                 download_method = "axel",

                 # PLOT ARGUMENTS 
                 plot.types=c("simple"),
                 plot.window = 500000/2,
                 )
